TopicTitle: Probodobodyne Probe Processor-59 [A New Part to Improve Transition Rates, Saving Electricity, and Reliving]

Articles.Content:
The Probodobodyne Probe Processor-59 is a part which I hope the Kerbal Space Program developer will add to the game. You know how KSP in Career mode and in Science mode you have to sometimes send date through a relay dish or a communications dish. But sometimes you want that part to go faster and more efficiently? Well. I propose the Probodobodyne Probe Processor-59 . This is a small attachment (Same size as the barometer). This part is a small processor which can speed transmission rates and do it with less. It can help the dish or communications equipment do it with 1 unit to 10 units less than normal! I think this would help many players for those who are in very tight places. It also would be pretty neat! Below I have chart regarding the engineers levels.

The levels to the corresponding electricity saved.
Not an Engineer 0.5 unit of electricity saved
Level One  1 unit saved
Level 2 2 units saved
Level 3 3 units saved
Level 4  5 to 6 units can be saved
Level 5 6 to 10 units can be saved

It will also be able to extend an antenna's range by 10% and access relays. Strapping more on will increase you relay by 5 percent. No change on electric savings. This would make tight situations really reliving and fun as you could always get an engineer and strap one on.

Here is the product description: 

"Using a revolutionary new algorithm called the Slow Fourier Transform, the Probodobodyne Probe Processor increases the range, efficiency, and speed of your spacecraft's antennas." (description cleverly made up by camacju. Thank you camacju !)

 

This part would make Kerbal Space Program very like, a roller coaster of events. OH no you went to space and you need the transmit data quick. reliving  you packed this gadget and were saved!

However this little processed will not make maneuver nodes, no autopilot, or anything else. It can only speed up and save electricity when transmitting data.

Edited March 5, 2021 by Dr. Kerbal
Please tell me if this part was a good idea or just garbage!
If you're gonna make it an advanced signal processing unit then another purpose could be an antenna extender so you can save antenna mass or cost or something.
